thread.title: ISIS fighters advance in Aleppo outskirts – monitor
thread.title_full: ISIS fighters advance in Aleppo outskirts – monitor | News24

author: news24.com
title: ISIS fighters advance in Aleppo outskirts – monitor
text:
Beirut - Islamic State fighters have captured several Syrian villages from rival insurgents near Aleppo, a monitoring group said on Friday, despite Russian air strikes that Moscow says have targeted the hardline group.
Rami Abdulrahman, head of the Syria Observatory for Human Rights, said Islamic State forces had taken over villages including Tel Suseen and Tel Qarah from other rebels groups just outside the city.
The advance, which he said marked their biggest gains in the area since late August, brought them within 2km of a government-held industrial zone on the northern edge of Aleppo, the largest city in north Syria.
Russian jets and warships have been bombarding targets across Syria for 10 days in a campaign which Moscow says is aimed at the Islamic State fighters who control large parts of north and east Syria, as well as swathes of neighbouring Iraq.
